intro: Djaloniella, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow composite flowers that resemble those of the dandelion. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Djaloniella species are often found in rocky soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
